web3.name: Solidity (Smart Contract)
web3.description: Check for security issues in your solidity smart contract before you deploy to an EVM chain
web3.vsExtensionInfo: Solidity Audit by Armur AI is a powerful Visual Studio Code extension that allows you to perform comprehensive code audits right from your favorite code editor. It provides insights into various aspects of your codebase, including Code Vulnerabilities, Code Documentation, Bugs, Optimization techniques, and much more.
web3.packageInfo: This tool is available via our github app that will scan your entire repo for relevant files and create a vulnerability scan report for you and also raise a pull request that you can merge.

web3.name: Ink! (Polkadot) Smart Contract
web3.description: Check for vulnerabilities, security issues and bugs in your Javascript code
web3.packageInfo: JavaScript primarily uses npm (Node Package Manager) for package management. Another popular package manager for JavaScript is yarn, which provides better performance and more predictable dependency resolution than npm.

llmSecurity.name: Malicious LLM Scanner
llmSecurity.description: Check for security issues in your solidity smart contract before you deploy to an EVM chain
llmSecurity.vsExtensionInfo: Go Audit by Armur AI is a powerful Visual Studio Code extension that allows you to perform comprehensive code audits right from your favorite code editor. It provides insights into various aspects of your codebase, including Code Vulnerabilities, Code Documentation, Bugs, Optimization techniques, and much more.
llmSecurity.packageInfo: The primary tool for managing dependencies in Go is go mod, which is integrated into the Go toolchain itself. It handles the downloading, installing, and managing of packages and modules.

llmSecurity.packageInfo: Rust uses cargo as its package manager. Cargo downloads Rust packages from crates.io, compiles them if necessary, and makes them available for your Rust programs.
